org.jetel.component.rollup

Class RecordRollupTL

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.component.AbstractTransformTL
      • org.jetel.component.rollup.RecordRollupTL
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RecordRollup, Transform

    public class RecordRollupTL
extends AbstractTransformTL
implements RecordRollup
    An implementation of the RecordRollup interface for the transformation language. Serves as a wrapper around the CTL code written by the user.
    Since:
    28th April 2009

      boolean finishGroup(DataRecord inputRecord, DataRecord groupAccumulator)

      This method is called for the first data record in a group.
      int transform(int counter, DataRecord inputRecord, DataRecord groupAccumulator, DataRecord[] outputRecords)
      This method is used to generate output data records based on the input data record and the contents of the group "accumulator" (if it was requested).
      int transformOnError(java.lang.Exception exception, int counter, DataRecord inputRecord, DataRecord groupAccumulator, DataRecord[] outputRecords)
      This method is used to generate output data records based on the input data record and the contents of the group "accumulator" (if it was requested).

      This method is called for each data record (including the first one as well as the last one) in a group in order to update the group "accumulator".

      • RecordRollupTL

        public RecordRollupTL(java.lang.String sourceCode,

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(java.util.Properties parameters,
        DataRecordMetadata inputMetadata,
        DataRecordMetadata accumulatorMetadata,
        DataRecordMetadata[] outputMetadata)
          throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: RecordRollup
        Initializes the rollup transform. This method is called once at the beginning of the life-cycle of the rollup transform. Any internal allocation/initialization code should be placed here.
        Specified by:
        init in interface RecordRollup
        Parameters:
        parameters - custom component attributes defined for the component which calls this transformation
        inputMetadata - metadata of input data records
        accumulatorMetadata - metadata of a group "accumulator" used to store intermediate results or null if no metadata were specified
        outputMetadata - array of metadata of output data records
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - if an error occurred during the initialization

      • initGroup

        public void initGroup(DataRecord inputRecord,
             DataRecord groupAccumulator)
               throws TransformException
        Description copied from interface: RecordRollup
        This method is called for the first data record in a group. Any initialization of the group "accumulator" should be placed here.
        Specified by:
        initGroup in interface RecordRollup
        Parameters:
        inputRecord - the first input data record in the group
        groupAccumulator - the data record used as an "accumulator" for the group or null if none was requested
        Throws:
        TransformException - if any error occurred during initialization of the group

      • initGroupOnError

        public void initGroupOnError(java.lang.Exception exception,
                    DataRecord inputRecord,
                    DataRecord groupAccumulator)
                      throws TransformException
        Description copied from interface: RecordRollup
        This method is called for the first data record in a group. Any initialization of the group "accumulator" should be placed here. Called only if RecordRollup.initGroup(DataRecord, DataRecord) throws an exception.
        Specified by:
        initGroupOnError in interface RecordRollup
        Parameters:
        exception - an exception that caused RecordRollup.initGroup(DataRecord, DataRecord) to fail
        inputRecord - the first input data record in the group
        groupAccumulator - the data record used as an "accumulator" for the group or null if none was requested
        Throws:
        TransformException - if any error occurred during initialization of the group

      • updateGroup

        public boolean updateGroup(DataRecord inputRecord,
                  DataRecord groupAccumulator)
                    throws TransformException
        Description copied from interface: RecordRollup
        This method is called for each data record (including the first one as well as the last one) in a group in order to update the group "accumulator".
        Specified by:
        updateGroup in interface RecordRollup
        Parameters:
        inputRecord - the current input data record
        groupAccumulator - the data record used as an "accumulator" for the group or null if none was requested
        Returns:
        true if the RecordRollup.updateTransform(int, DataRecord, DataRecord, DataRecord[]) method should be called to generate output data record(s) and send them to the output, false otherwise
        Throws:
        TransformException - if any error occurred during update of the group

      • updateGroupOnError

        public boolean updateGroupOnError(java.lang.Exception exception,
                         DataRecord inputRecord,
                         DataRecord groupAccumulator)
                           throws TransformException
        Description copied from interface: RecordRollup
        This method is called for each data record (including the first one as well as the last one) in a group in order to update the group "accumulator". Called only if RecordRollup.updateGroup(DataRecord, DataRecord) throws an exception.
        Specified by:
        updateGroupOnError in interface RecordRollup
        Parameters:
        exception - an exception that caused RecordRollup.updateGroup(DataRecord, DataRecord) to fail
        inputRecord - the current input data record
        groupAccumulator - the data record used as an "accumulator" for the group or null if none was requested
        Returns:
        true if the RecordRollup.updateTransform(int, DataRecord, DataRecord, DataRecord[]) method should be called to generate output data record(s) and send them to the output, false otherwise
        Throws:
        TransformException - if any error occurred during update of the group

      • finishGroup

        public boolean finishGroup(DataRecord inputRecord,
                  DataRecord groupAccumulator)
                    throws TransformException
        Description copied from interface: RecordRollup
        This method is called for the last data record in a group in order to finish the group processing.
        Specified by:
        finishGroup in interface RecordRollup
        Parameters:
        inputRecord - any input data record from the current group
        groupAccumulator - the data record used as an "accumulator" for the group or null if none was requested
        Returns:
        true if the RecordRollup.transform(int, DataRecord, DataRecord, DataRecord[]) method should be called to generate output data record(s) and send them to the output, false otherwise
        Throws:
        TransformException - if any error occurred during final processing of the group

      • finishGroupOnError

        public boolean finishGroupOnError(java.lang.Exception exception,
                         DataRecord inputRecord,
                         DataRecord groupAccumulator)
                           throws TransformException
        Description copied from interface: RecordRollup
        This method is called for the last data record in a group in order to finish the group processing. Called only if RecordRollup.finishGroup(DataRecord, DataRecord) throws an exception.
        Specified by:
        finishGroupOnError in interface RecordRollup
        Parameters:
        exception - an exception that caused RecordRollup.finishGroup(DataRecord, DataRecord) to fail
        inputRecord - any input data record from the current group
        groupAccumulator - the data record used as an "accumulator" for the group or null if none was requested
        Returns:
        true if the RecordRollup.transform(int, DataRecord, DataRecord, DataRecord[]) method should be called to generate output data record(s) and send them to the output, false otherwise
        Throws:
        TransformException - if any error occurred during final processing of the group

      • updateTransform

        public int updateTransform(int counter,
                  DataRecord inputRecord,
                  DataRecord groupAccumulator,
                  DataRecord[] outputRecords)
                    throws TransformException
        Description copied from interface: RecordRollup
        This method is used to generate output data records based on the input data record and the contents of the group "accumulator" (if it was requested). The output data record will be sent to the output when this method finishes. This method is called whenever the RecordRollup.updateGroup(DataRecord, DataRecord) method returns true.
        Specified by:
        updateTransform in interface RecordRollup
        Parameters:
        counter - the number of previous calls to this method for the current group update
        inputRecord - the current input data record
        groupAccumulator - the data record used as an "accumulator" for the group or null if none was requested
        outputRecords - output data records to be filled with data
        Returns:
        RecordRollup.ALL -- send the data record(s) to all the output ports
        >= 0 -- send one data record to a specified output port
        RecordRollup.SKIP -- end processing of the current group
        < RecordRollup.SKIP -- fatal error, stop the execution
        Throws:
        TransformException - if any error occurred during the transformation

      • updateTransformOnError

        public int updateTransformOnError(java.lang.Exception exception,
                         int counter,
                         DataRecord inputRecord,
                         DataRecord groupAccumulator,
                         DataRecord[] outputRecords)
                           throws TransformException
        Description copied from interface: RecordRollup
        This method is used to generate output data records based on the input data record and the contents of the group "accumulator" (if it was requested). The output data record will be sent to the output when this method finishes. This method is called whenever the RecordRollup.updateGroup(DataRecord, DataRecord) method returns true. Called only if RecordRollup.updateTransform(int, DataRecord, DataRecord, DataRecord[]) throws an exception.
        Specified by:
        updateTransformOnError in interface RecordRollup
        Parameters:
        exception - an exception that caused RecordRollup.updateTransform(int, DataRecord, DataRecord, DataRecord[]) to fail
        counter - the number of previous calls to this method for the current group update
        inputRecord - the current input data record
        groupAccumulator - the data record used as an "accumulator" for the group or null if none was requested
        outputRecords - output data records to be filled with data
        Returns:
        RecordRollup.ALL -- send the data record(s) to all the output ports
        >= 0 -- send one data record to a specified output port
        RecordRollup.SKIP -- end processing of the current group
        < RecordRollup.SKIP -- fatal error, stop the execution
        Throws:
        TransformException - if any error occurred during the transformation

      • transform

        public int transform(int counter,
            DataRecord inputRecord,
            DataRecord groupAccumulator,
            DataRecord[] outputRecords)
              throws TransformException
        Description copied from interface: RecordRollup
        This method is used to generate output data records based on the input data record and the contents of the group "accumulator" (if it was requested). The output data record will be sent to the output when this method finishes. This method is called whenever the RecordRollup.finishGroup(DataRecord, DataRecord) method returns true.
        Specified by:
        transform in interface RecordRollup
        Parameters:
        counter - the number of previous calls to this method for the current group
        inputRecord - any input data record from the current group
        groupAccumulator - the data record used as an "accumulator" for the group or null if none was requested
        outputRecords - output data records to be filled with data
        Returns:
        RecordRollup.ALL -- send the data record(s) to all the output ports
        >= 0 -- send one data record to a specified output port
        RecordRollup.SKIP -- end processing of the current group
        < RecordRollup.SKIP -- fatal error, stop the execution
        Throws:
        TransformException - if any error occurred during the transformation

      • transformOnError

        public int transformOnError(java.lang.Exception exception,
                   int counter,
                   DataRecord inputRecord,
                   DataRecord groupAccumulator,
                   DataRecord[] outputRecords)
                     throws TransformException
        Description copied from interface: RecordRollup
        This method is used to generate output data records based on the input data record and the contents of the group "accumulator" (if it was requested). The output data record will be sent to the output when this method finishes. This method is called whenever the RecordRollup.finishGroup(DataRecord, DataRecord) method returns true. Called only if RecordRollup.transform(int, DataRecord, DataRecord, DataRecord[]) throws an exception.
        Specified by:
        transformOnError in interface RecordRollup
        Parameters:
        exception - an exception that caused RecordRollup.transform(int, DataRecord, DataRecord, DataRecord[]) to fail
        counter - the number of previous calls to this method for the current group
        inputRecord - any input data record from the current group
        groupAccumulator - the data record used as an "accumulator" for the group or null if none was requested
        outputRecords - output data records to be filled with data
        Returns:
        RecordRollup.ALL -- send the data record(s) to all the output ports
        >= 0 -- send one data record to a specified output port
        RecordRollup.SKIP -- end processing of the current group
        < RecordRollup.SKIP -- fatal error, stop the execution
        Throws:
        TransformException - if any error occurred during the transformation
